lines.text: Well, well, well, well, well. You really did drop in from Heaven.
Well, I guess I did.
Maybe if you could... you could try and find your mom?
My mom? She threw me away. She threw me away!
[last lines]
When are they coming?
Soon.
So they're taking me to death row? I'm gonna die now.
[Buddy hugs her as she cries]
I don't wanna die now!
[Amanda tells Wanda about Harvey raping her]
Will you please, just make him go?

Oh, yeah, he's going alright; and I'm going with him, because you better believe - Harvey and me - we've got big plans. And you better put the breaks on right quick, girl, or you're out of the picture.
[Mike watches Amanda dancing at the strip joint]
She just doesn't seem the type.
None of them are at first. You know how old she really is? 14.
What the hell is she doing in here?
She likes to eat.

[curious about Amanda in the strip joint]
How old are you?

[sarcastically]
18, nearly - 17 and a half.

[noticing she is eating popcorn]
I hope that's not your supper.
How come you get to be so interested?

[reading "Rumplestilskin" to Mike's kids]
'All the world is his game, and 'Rumblestin' is his name'.
[Sally and Web burst out laughing]
No, not Rumblestin. Rum-ple-stil-skin.

[after a flashback reveals that Amanda did kill Mike]
I was on so many drugs and there was so much stuff going on. What I can figure out is - is that I loved Mike. I really loved him.
Lots of kids with lives like Amanda grow up to become doctors. Now she made a choice. I don't want to see anybody die.

Look, I don't want to dismiss what happened on that night in the oil fields in Horne, Oklahoma. That was tragic. But the tragedy is yours and mine as well. You see, Amanda is a child of our times. And the prosecutor was right when he said there were many child like her raoming our streets. But is she is guilty of this crime, then society is guilty as well.
We need you to get away from that strip joint - away from Billy.
Well, I'm only hanging on there until I'm old enough to get me a regular job, find me a man, and start a family of my own.
Hell, don't go talking about no kids. You are still a kid yourself.
Well you're forgetting something, honey, I was married before and you ain't.

[letter to Amanda]
The last three months is the most miserable I ever been in my life. I just don't want you no more. We can't be no worse off apart than we've been together. At least I'll have a chance in the army. You go on home to your mama.

Every day, stories of gangs of 15-year-olds roaming the streets in almost every city of our country killing and raping. 12-year-olds running wild packing guns. This is a new breed, and Amanda is just one of them. We have to send a clear message to the Amandas of this world that they can no longer work and evil and get away with it! She must DIE for her crime!
